panels.description: Trend of persistence requests per operation in the time range selected. (cluster load over time per operation).
panels.title: Persistence Requests by Operation (Trend 5m Rate)

panels.description: The number of persistence requests over the time range selected., grouped by cluster operation.
panels.title: Persistence Requests by Operation (5m Rate Total)

panels.description: The 99th percentile lock acquisition latency for workflow history shards ('ShardInfo') during the time range selected. Shows lock impact on workflow progress.
panels.title: Shard Lock Latency (p99)

panels.description: The 99th percentile lock acquisition latency for workflow history ('HistoryCacheGetOrCreate') during the time range selected. Shows lock impact on workflow progress.
panels.title: History Cache Lock Latency (p99)

panels.description: The number of gRPC requests to add new activities in the time range selected. Useful to monitor initiation of activities.
panels.title: AddActivityTask Requests (rate)

panels.description: The number of gRPC requests recording the start of an activity in the time range selected. Monitor against the previous panel to represent latency between scheduling and execution.
panels.title: RecordActivityTaskStarted Requests (rate)

panels.description: The number of gRPC requests recording the end of an activity in the time range selected. Monitor against the previous panel to represent completion latency.
panels.title: ActivityTask End Requests (rate)

panels.description: Overall % of successful gRPC requests using time range specified (all services). Useful to monitor cluster health.
panels.title: Service Availability

panels.description: Percentage of successful requests to the persistence service in the time range selected (cluster-wide).
panels.title: Persistence Service Success %

panels.description: Number of errors by type for service_name="frontend" in the time range selected.
panels.title: Service Errors by Type (frontend)

panels.description: Number of errors by type for service_name="history" in the time range selected.
panels.title: Service Errors by Type (history)

panels.description: Number of errors by type for service_name="matching" in the time range selected..
panels.title: Service Errors by Type (matching)

panels.description: Number of errors by type for service_name="worker" in the time range selected..
panels.title: Service Errors by Type (worker)
Resource exhaustion by namespace, cause and servicename

panels.description: The 95th percentile latency of gRPC calls to the 'frontend' service, grouped by operation over the time range selected. Substitute another service_name as needed.
panels.title: 95th Percentile Latency by Operation (frontend)

panels.description: The 95th percentile latency of gRPC calls to the 'frontend' service, grouped by operation over the time range selected. Substitute another service_name as needed.
panels.title: 95th Percentile Latency by Operation (matching)

panels.description: The 95th percentile latency of gRPC calls to the 'frontend' service, grouped by operation over the time range selected. Substitute another service_name as needed.
panels.title: 95th Percentile Latency by Operation (history)

panels.description: The number of gRPC requests coming into the cluster from external clients (start workflows or signals) during the time range selected.
panels.title: External Events: Workflow & Signal Requests

panels.description: The number of gRPC requests to add new workflows in the time range selected. Monitor with 'RecordWorkflowTaskStarted', 'RespondWorkflowTaskCompleted', and 'RespondWorkflowTaskFailed' to observe expected state transitions.
panels.title: AddWorkflowTask Requests (rate)

panels.description: The number of workflows in the time range selected that exceeded maximum schedule-to-start timeout. Indicates if workers are busy or unavailable.
panels.title: ScheduleToStart Timeout (rate)

panels.description: The number of workflows in the time range selected that exceeded schedule-to-close timeout. Indicates workflows may not be completing due to slowdowns.
panels.title: ScheduleToClose Timeout (rate)

names: {__name__="service_errors", app_kubernetes_io_component="history", app_kubernetes_io_instance="my-temporal", app_kubernetes_io_managed_by="Helm", app_kubernetes_io_name="temporal", app_kubernetes_io_part_of="temporal", app_kubernetes_io_version="1.28.0", helm_sh_chart="temporal-0.64.0", instance="10.244.0.29:9090", job="kubernetes-pods", namespace="default", node="temporal-workshop-2025-control-plane", operation="RecordWorkflowTaskStarted", pod="my-temporal-history-646986d597-66nkx", pod_template_hash="646986d597", service_name="history", type="history"}

panels.title: Pending Requests per namespace and operation (Frontend)

panels.description: Rate of timeouts over 2 minute ranges
panels.title: Sum of Start to Close timeouts (5m)

panels.description: The number of cluster service restarts, grouped by service, in the time range selected. Frequent restarts indicate underlying issues.
panels.title: Cluster Service Restarts

panels.description: The number of 'resource exhausted' errors, grouped by cause, during the time range selected. Indicates rate limits/system overload.
panels.title: Resource Exhausted Errors

panels.description: The number of state transitions persisted to the database in the time range selected. Indicates cluster throughput.
panels.title: State Transitions (rate)

panels.description: Number of History shard rebalances in the time range selected. Frequent rebalancing not due to scaling may indicate node issues.
panels.title: Shard Rebalances (rate)

panels.description: Average number of worker task slots available for WorkflowWorker in the time range selected. Hitting zero indicates worker backlog.
panels.title: Available Worker Task Slots (avg over time)

panels.description: Latency from when a workflow task enters the queue to when a worker picks it up in the time range selected. Monitor per namespace and task queue.
panels.title: Workflow Task Schedule-to-Start Latency

panels.description: Latency from when an activity task enters the queue to when a worker picks it up in the time range selected. Monitor per namespace and task queue.
panels.title: Activity Task Schedule-to-Start Latency

panels.description: The 'sync match rate' between workers and matching service during the time range selected. High rates reduce task latency and persistence load.
panels.title: Sync Match Rate
